page.title: 08FARMING - BYEASTWOOD FARM
page.content: Byeastwood Farm is on the edge of Coity village. It is typical of a local farm of its size. The farm house is over 300 years old. The farm has a dairy herd of 38 cows. The milk is sent by tanker to Porth (Rhondda) Dairy. Each year approximately 22 calves are born on the farm. These are kept until they are yearling-some are fattened for beef and some become part of the dairy herd. The farm is l30 acres-25 acres of grazing, 60 acres for hay, 44 of barley (on rotation) and 1 acre for potatoes. The barley & hay is used for winter feeding and straw for bedding. 6,000 bales of hay are produced annually. The farm has 4 tractors and 1 combine harvester. Mr.& Mrs Williams and son Gareth work the farm.
